tool.tool-name: TEW: Java and JavaScript .properties File Converter

trans-unit.note: Button that opens the action menu KEY=ACTIONS
Button in action menu that allows pinning to a new dashboard. opens popup for entering the dashboard details KEY=CREATE_NEW_DB
Button in action menu that allows pinning to a given dashboard KEY=PUBLISH_TO
Button in action menu that allows pinning to the home screen KEY=PUBLISH_TO_HS

trans-unit.source: Failed to pin to home screen.
trans-unit.note: shown to user if sharing a chart to the homescreen failed. KEY=ERROR_FAIL_TO_ADD_TILE_TO_HS
shown to user if a chart was shared successfully to the homescreen KEY=SUCCESS_ADDED_TILE_SUCCESSFULLY_TO_HS

trans-unit.source: Sorry, we cannot provide a {0} visualization for your current selection!
trans-unit.note: warning in visualization pane that the selected chart cannot render the selected data KEY=ERROR_INVALID_DATA_SET_USERMSG

trans-unit.source: Sorry, we cannot provide a chart for your current selection!
trans-unit.note: warning in visualization pane that the selected data returns no data and thus cannot be rendered with any chart. KEY=ERROR_INVALID_DATA_SET_CHART_USERMSG

trans-unit.source: No data could be retrieved from the server.
trans-unit.note: detail hint that says that no data could be retrieved. Reason for why no chart could be rendered KEY=ERROR_RETRIEVE_DATA
default hint in visualization pane that indicates what the user can change for making the chart render KEY=DEFAULT_HINT

trans-unit.source: Please select a valid data set.
trans-unit.note: hint in visualization pane that indicates what the user has to change to make the table render KEY=TABLE_HINT
used in generated chart title to connect dimension and measures, e.g., "Revenue per Year" KEY=PER
used in generated chart title to connect dimension members and measures, e.g., "Revenue for 2014" KEY=FOR
used in generated chart sub title to indicate that the values are in a certain unit, e.g., "in $" KEY=IN
used in generated KPI title to abbreviate the list of measures and dimensions KEY=AND_X_MORE
used in generated chart title to abbreviate the list of measures and dimensions KEY=AND_OTHERS

trans-unit.source: Error: Please select cells of an account to create a KPI.
trans-unit.note: shown if the selection in grid does not contain an account so that no KPIs can be defined and the dialog for that cannot be opened KEY=KPI_ERROR_SELECTION

trans-unit.source: Error: KPI spanning multiple accounts are not supported
trans-unit.note: shown if the selection in grid spans multiple accounts. this is not supported. the KPI modeler dialog cannot be opened KEY=KPI_ERROR_MULTIPLE_ACCOUNTS_SELECTION

trans-unit.source: Error: KPIs spanning over dimensions with different units are not supported
trans-unit.note: shown if the selection in grid spans multiple accounts. this is not supported. the KPI modeler dialog cannot be opened KEY=KPI_ERROR_MULTIPLE_UNITS_SELECTION

trans-unit.source: Error: KPI with filters by more than one member are not supported
trans-unit.note: shown if a dimension of the report has been filtered to more than one dimension members, which is not supported by the KPI implementation. KEY=KPI_ERROR_MULTI_MEMBER_FILTER

trans-unit.source: Error: The selection overlaps with already defined KPIs
trans-unit.note: shown if the selection in grid overlaps with cells that have already KPIs defined. This is not supported, the KPI modeler dialog cannot be opened KEY=KPI_NON_DISJOINT_OR_EQUAL_SELECTION

trans-unit.source: The selection overlaps with the already existing KPI: {0}
trans-unit.note: Info shown in a special dialog if the selection in grid overlaps with cells that have already a KPI defined. KEY=KPI_OVERLAP_SELECTION

trans-unit.source: The selection includes the already existing KPI: {0}
trans-unit.note: Info shown in a special dialog if the selection in grid includes cells that have already a KPI defined. KEY=KPI_INCLUDE_SELECTION

trans-unit.source: The selection is included by an already existing KPI: {0}
trans-unit.note: Info shown in a special dialog if the selection in grid is included by cells that have already a KPI defined. KEY=KPI_INCLUDED_BY_SELECTION
Dialog title of the KPI modeler dialog for overlapping cases KEY=KPI_OVERLAP
Info shown to the user indicating that he should select an option. KEY=KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_CHOOSE
Label of the radio button for the option to edit the existing KPI in overlap case KEY=KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_EDIT

trans-unit.source: Opens edit dialog for the existing KPI.
trans-unit.note: Help Info for the option to edit the existing KPI in overlap case (presented next to KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_EDIT) KEY=KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_EDIT_HELP
Label of the radio button for the option to change the existing KPI in overlap case KEY=KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_CHANGE

trans-unit.source: Changes the scope of the existing KPI to your selection and then opens the edit dialog.
trans-unit.note: Help Info for the option to change the existing KPI in overlap case (presented next to KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_CHANGE) KEY=KPI_OVERLAP_OPTION_CHANGE_HELP

trans-unit.source: Do you really want to change the scope of the already defined KPI '{0}'?
trans-unit.note: Question to the user to ask him to confirm the change of the scope the specific KPI applies to KEY=KPI_CONFIRM_CHANGE_SCOPE
Dialog title of the KPI modeler dialog. used when creating a new KPI KEY=KPI_DEFINITION
Section title of the KPI modeler dialog. used when creating a new KPI KEY=KPI_NAME
Section title of the KPI modeler dialog. used when creating a new KPI KEY=KPI_THRESHOLDS
Button text to add new KPI.
Dialog title of the KPI modeler dialog. used when editing a new KPI KEY=KPI_EDITING
apply button in the KPI modeler dialog. apply the changes and return to grid KEY=KPI_APPLY
Button in Create/Edit-KPI dialog box shown for initial reports that trigger a report-save-as action when a KPI threshold is created KEY=KPI_SAVE_AND_APPLY

trans-unit.source: Error: Missing update permissions for KPIs
trans-unit.note: shown when the user makes an overlapping selection with existing KPIs, but does not have update rights KEY=KPI_MISSING_UPDATE_RIGHTS

trans-unit.source: Error: Missing create permissions for KPIs
trans-unit.note: shown when the user does not make an overlapping selection with existing KPIs, but does not have create rights KEY=KPI_MISSING_CREATE_RIGHTS

trans-unit.source: Error: Missing delete permissions for KPIs
trans-unit.note: shown when the user attempts to delete a kpi, but does not have delete rights KEY=KPI_MISSING_DELETE_RIGHTS

trans-unit.source: Warning: multiple level dimension members are selected: KPI will be created only on lowest level members
trans-unit.note: shown when the user select multiple level dimension members when creating a KPI
delete button in the KPI modeler dialog. Delete the KPI and return to Grid. KEY=KPI_DELETE
Cancel button in the KPI modeler dialog. Cancel editing / creation and return to grid KEY=KPI_CANCEL
Status for a KPI to be on Normal/ok level or green. used for selection in the KPI modeler dialog KEY=KPI_OK
Status for a KPI to be on Warning level or yellow. used for selection in the KPI modeler dialog KEY=KPI_WARNING
Status for a KPI to be on Critical level or red. used for selection in the KPI modeler dialog KEY=KPI_CRITICAL

trans-unit.source: Error: the KPI could not be saved
trans-unit.note: shown after the user pressed save KPI but that failed KEY=KPI_SAVE_ERROR

trans-unit.source: KPI with different unit already defined here
trans-unit.note: shown when a user tries to create a KPI on cells for which there are already KPIs defined that are currently not visible, as they are defined for another unit / currency KEY=KPI_UNIT_MITMATCH
placeholder for the KPI lower value fields in the KPI modeler dialog. shown if it does not contain any value KEY=KPI_MIN_VALUE_PLACEHOLDER
placeholder for the KPI upper value fields in the KPI modeler dialog. shown if it does not contain any value KEY=KPI_MAX_VALUE_PLACEHOLDER
placeholder for the KPI interval name fields in the KPI modeler dialog. shown if it does not contain any value KEY=KPI_NAME_PLACEHOLDER
Tooltip on button to delete an interval in the KPI modeler dialog KEY=KPI_DELETE_INTERVAL
Tooltip on button to add an interval in the KPI modeler dialog KEY=KPI_ADD_INTERVAL
KPI placeholder name, e.g. KPI 1, KPI 2 KEY = KPI_CUSTOM_CELL_NAME
name of bar chart. used in various places like the visualization type selection popup KEY=BAR
name of column chart. used in various places like the visualization type selection popup KEY=COLUMN
name of stacked bar chart. used in various places like the visualization type selection popup KEY=STACKED_BAR
name of stacked column chart. used in various places like the visualization type selection popup KEY=STACKED_COLUMN
name of gauge chart. used in various places like the visualization type selection popup KEY=GAUGE
name of drill column chart KEY=DRILL_COLUMN
tooltip for export as csv button KEY=EXPORT_CSV

trans-unit.source: At least one interval end must be specified
trans-unit.note: displayed next to one of the interval ends input field to show that it contains invalid content in KPI modeler dialog KEY=NON_SPECIFIED_INTERVAL_ENDS_MESSAGE
displayed next to one of the interval ends input field to show that it contains invalid content in KPI modeler dialog KEY=INVALID_INTERVAL_ENDS_MESSAGE

trans-unit.source: Only numbers are allowed as interval ends
trans-unit.note: displayed next to one of the interval ends input field to show that it contains invalid content in KPI modeler dialog KEY=INVALID_INTERVAL_FORMAT_MESSAGE

trans-unit.source: Left interval end must be lower than right interval end
trans-unit.note: displayed next to one of the interval ends input field to show that it contains invalid content in KPI modeler dialog KEY=MAX_BEFORE_MIN_INTERVAL_ENDS_MESSAGE

trans-unit.source: Only alphanumeric characters, spaces and the "_" symbols are allowed
trans-unit.note: displayed next to the interval name input field to show that it contains invalid content in KPI modeler dialog KEY=INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME_MESSAGE
Suffix for dimension names in the visualization that have been created artificially KEY=CHART_PERSPECTIVE_LEVEL
label for input field for editing the chart title KEY=TITLE
label for input field for editing the chart subtitle KEY=SUBTITLE
placeholder for input field for chart title if nothing is set yet KEY=NEW_TITLE
showing that a number in the gauge bar chart is the actual value (compared to target). upper case is by design KEY=ACTUAL
hint for the user that no thresholds are defined KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_NO_THRESHOLD

trans-unit.source: Reduce the amount of intervals until you have only two that intersect in one value
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to reduce the amount of intervals, because there are too many of them KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_TOO_MANY_INTERVALS

trans-unit.source: Change the two intervals so that that there is no gap to the left, the right, or in between.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to make the two intervals intersecting

trans-unit.source: Create another interval that intersects in one value with the existing interval.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to create another interval, because there are too few (only 1) KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_TOO_FEW_INTERVALS
hint for the user to create intervals, because there are none at the moment KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_CREATE_TWO_INTERVALS

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have exactly {0} value(s) selected.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to select an exact amount of values in the grid KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_EXACT_VALUE

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have between {0} and {1} values selected.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to select an amount of values between min and max in the grid KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_RANGE_VALUE

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have exactly {0} accounts selected.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to select an exact amount of measures in the grid KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_EXACT_MEASURE

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have between {0} and {1} accounts selected.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user to select an amount of measures between min and max in the grid KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_RANGE_MEASURE
hint for the user to create any amount of intervals, because there are none at the moment KEY=VALIDATION_HINT_CREATE_INTERVALS
label used as a header in the KPIs overview panel to indicate that the section containing the KPIs tree starts KEY=KPI_LIST_INTERVALS_OVERVIEW_TITLE
label used as a header in KPIs overview panel to indicate that the section containing the KPI's intervals starts KEY=KPI_LIST_KPIS_OVERVIEW_TITLE
tooltip used for the KPI edit icon in the KPIs overview panel KEY=KPI_LIST_EDIT_KPI
tooltip used for the KPI edit icon in the KPIs overview panel KEY=KPI_LIST_NO_RIGHTS_TO_EDIT_KPI
tooltip used for the KPI delete icon in the KPIs overview panel KEY=KPI_LIST_DELETE_KPI
tooltip used for the KPI delete icon in the KPIs overview panel KEY=KPI_LIST_NO_RIGHTS_TO_DELETE_KPI

trans-unit.source: Do you want to delete the selected KPI?
trans-unit.note: message shown in the confirmation dialog open at the deletion of a KPI KEY=KPI_LIST_CONFIRM_KPI_DELETION_MESSAGE

trans-unit.source: You have to select a KPI to see its Threshold.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user that the variance chart needs the version dimension KEY=KPI_THRESHOLDS_LIST_EMPTY_MESSAGE

trans-unit.source: Include the version dimension in your selection.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user that the variance chart needs the version dimension KEY=VARIANCE_SELECT_VERSION_PERSPECTIVE

trans-unit.source: Include the time dimension in your selection.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user that the variance chart needs the time dimension KEY=VARIANCE_SELECT_TIME_PERSPECTIVE
hint for the user that there are too few dimensions selected for the variance chart KEY=VARIANCE_SELECT_MORE_PERSPECTIVES
tooltip for next button on pagination KEY=PAGINATION_NEXT
tooltip for previous button on pagination KEY=PAGINATION_PREV

trans-unit.source: Do not include only blank values in your selection.
trans-unit.note: hint for the user that the chart needs the measure to contain non-null data KEY=CHART_SELECT_NON_NULL_MEASURE
label for the variance part of the variance chart KEY=VARIANCE
label for the variance part of the variance chart KEY=VARIANCE2
label for the amount part of the variance chart KEY=AMOUNT
dialog label for selecting the base line KEY=BASELINE
dialog label for selecting the base line KEY=REFERENCE
dialog label for selecting the variance type KEY=VARIANCE_TYPE
option label for selecting variance type "absolute" KEY=ABSOLUTE
option label for selecting variance type "relative" KEY=RELATIVE
title for variance charts, result will be something like "Revenue for 2013, 2014" KEY=VARIANCE_TITLE

trans-unit.source: Select only single account member dimension for value driver tree
trans-unit.note: Value driver tree validation, only single select cell shoud be allowed
Text on change chart orientation option
